full_translation:
**The Supreme Cavern Mystery Numinous Treasure Talismans of the Five Marchmounts**

**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Cavern Mystery Numinous Treasure Talismans of the Five Marchmounts*. Also known as *The Chart of the Divine Immortals of the Five Marchmounts*. Author unknown, approximately composed during the Northern and Southern Dynasties. Cited in Fa Lin’s *Treatise on Rectifying Errors* of the Tang. One fascicle. Base text from the *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, Cavern Mystery Division, Numinous Talismans category.

**The Supreme Cavern Mystery Numinous Treasure Talismans of the Five Marchmounts**

The *Chart of the Divine Immortals* states:
The numen of the Eastern Marchmount is called Mount Tai, its primordial *qi* ascending to connect with Jupiter. Its mountain is green. The Venerable Lord of Numinous Elders governs within, presiding over the *qi* of spring and the generation of the myriad beings. Arrayed in attendance are one hundred twenty Jade Maidens of the Azure Waist, who oversee the one hundred twenty palaces. Nine Transfiguring Jade Maidens govern the Nine Provinces. Twelve thousand Jade Maidens of Mountain Spirits patrol and protect the world, dispatching the spirits of *jia* and *yi* to enact celestial virtue, and the spirits of *yin* and *mao* to rectify terrestrial *qi*. On the day of the Beginning of Spring, the myriad spirits of the world’s famous mountains and great marshes ascend Mount Tai, entering the Palace of Azure Stone and Jade Towers to pay homage to the Azure Numinous Elder and receive the Mysterious Talismans. They emerge riding the *tiaofeng* winds, returning to the four directions to summon and command the hundred demons, slaying malevolent spirits. Those who disobey the Mysterious Talismans shall have their essence extinguished by Heaven and be denied the offerings of their sacrifices. Thus do they assist Heaven and Earth in generating the beings of the world. With the *qi* of the *tiaofeng* winds, they refine and purify human forms; if a human form is not upright, they rectify it with talismans. Those who regularly rise with *jia* and *yi* and govern *yin* and *mao*, and who ought to receive talismans and pay homage, all turn toward the sundial.

The *Chart of the Divine Immortals* states:
The numen of the Southern Marchmount is called Mount Heng of the South, its primordial *qi* ascending to connect with Mars. Its mountain is red. The Venerable Lord of Scorching Solar Elders governs within, presiding over the *qi* of summer and the growth of the myriad beings. Arrayed in attendance are one hundred twenty Jade Maidens of Grand Cinnabar, who oversee the one hundred twenty palaces. Nine Transfiguring Jade Maidens govern the Nine Provinces. Twelve thousand Jade Maidens of Mountain Spirits patrol and protect the world, dispatching the spirits of *bing* and *ding* to enact celestial virtue, and the spirits of *si* and *wu* to rectify terrestrial *qi*. On the day of the Beginning of Summer, the myriad spirits of the world’s famous mountains and great marshes ascend Mount Heng of the South, entering the Palace of Red Stone and Jade Towers to pay homage to the Scorching Elder and receive the Mysterious Talismans. They emerge riding the *changfeng* winds, returning to the four directions to summon and command the hundred demons, slaying malevolent spirits. Those who disobey the Mysterious Talismans shall have their essence extinguished by Heaven and be denied the offerings of their sacrifices. Thus do they assist Heaven and Earth in generating the beings of the world. With the *qi* of the *changfeng* winds, they refine and purify human forms; if a human form is not upright, they rectify it with talismans. Those who regularly rise with *bing* and *ding* and govern *si* and *wu*, and who ought to receive talismans and pay homage, all turn toward the sundial.

The *Chart of the Divine Immortals* states:
The numen of the Central Marchmount is called Mount Song, its primordial *qi* ascending to connect with Saturn. Its mountain is yellow. The Yellow Venerable Lord governs within, presiding over the *qi* of the four seasons, unifying the spirits of the four marchmounts, and overseeing the myriad beings. Arrayed in attendance are Jade Maidens of the Yellow Simplicity, with fifty thousand Transfiguring Jade Maidens in each of the four directions, who patrol and circulate. Fifty thousand Jade Maidens of Mountain Spirits patrol and protect the world, dispatching the spirits of *wu* and *ji* to enact celestial virtue, and the spirits of *chou-chen* and *wei-xu* to rectify terrestrial *qi*. On the last day of the first month of each season, the myriad spirits of the world’s famous mountains and great marshes ascend Mount Song, entering the Palace of Yellow Stone and Jade Towers to pay homage to the Yellow Venerable Lord and receive the Mysterious Talismans. They emerge riding the Eight Winds, returning to the four directions. The Mysterious Talisman ever abides in *ji*; without speech, the Dao is naturally present; without action, the Dao is naturally luminous. In quiescence and non-action lies the root of the Dao. If it issues forth, illness arises, yet it remains unill. My non-illness means death has no way to approach. Thus does the Mysterious Talisman eternally guard your life, covered by the Canopy of Florescence, prolonging your years with Saturn’s stability. When Saturn’s staff is endangered, the great gates of Heaven close, the portals of Earth widen, and in profound obscurity, the myriad spirits arise spontaneously. The Mysterious Talismans of the Five Marchmounts are the tokens of the Five Powers’ fidelity, rewarding good and punishing evil, nurturing the beings of the world. Thus, with the Eight Winds harmonizing the talismans, they regulate and rectify humanity. Those who ought to receive talismans and pay homage all turn toward the sundial.

The *Chart of the Divine Immortals* states:
The numen of the Western Marchmount is called Mount Hua of the West, its primordial *qi* ascending to connect with Venus. Its mountain is white. The August Venerable Lord governs within, presiding over the *qi* of autumn and the ripening of the myriad beings. Arrayed in attendance are one hundred twenty Jade Maidens of White Simplicity, who oversee the one hundred twenty palaces. Nine Transfiguring Jade Maidens govern the Nine Provinces. Twelve thousand Jade Maidens of Mountain Spirits patrol and protect the world, dispatching the spirits of *geng* and *xin* to enact celestial virtue, and the spirits of *shen* and *you* to rectify terrestrial *qi*. On the day of the Beginning of Autumn, the myriad spirits of the world’s famous mountains and great marshes ascend Mount Hua of the West, entering the Palace of White Stone and Jade Towers to pay homage to the August Elder and receive the Mysterious Talismans. They emerge riding the *qingfeng* winds, returning to the four directions to summon and command the hundred demons, slaying malevolent spirits. Those who disobey the Mysterious Talismans shall have their essence extinguished by Heaven and be denied the offerings of their sacrifices. Thus do they assist Heaven and Earth in ripening the beings of the world. With the *qi* of the *qingfeng* winds, they refine and purify human forms; if a human form is not upright, they rectify it with talismans. Those who regularly govern *shen* and *you* with *geng* and *xin*, and who ought to receive talismans and pay homage, all turn toward the sundial.

The *Chart of the Divine Immortals* states:
The numen of the Northern Marchmount is called Mount Heng of the North, its primordial *qi* ascending to connect with Mercury. Its mountain is black. The Venerable Lord of Mysterious Lunar Elders governs within, presiding over the *qi* of winter and the storage of the myriad beings. Arrayed in attendance are one hundred twenty Jade Maidens of Grand Mystery, who oversee the one hundred twenty palaces. Nine Transfiguring Jade Maidens govern the Nine Provinces.

The Mountain Spirits and Jade Maidens, numbering twelve thousand, govern the roaming protection of the world. They dispatch the *shen* of *ren* and *gui* to enact the celestial virtue, and the *shen* of *hai* and *zi* to rectify the terrestrial *qi*. On the sacred mountains and great marshes, the myriad *shen* of the world, on the day of the Beginning of Winter, ascend Mount Heng of the North and enter the palace of Black Stone Jade Gates to pay homage to the Venerable Lord of Mysterious Lunar Elders and receive the Mysterious Talismans. Emerging, they ride the cool winds and return to the four directions, summoning the hundred ghosts and slaying malevolent *shen*. Those who do not obey the Mysterious Talismans have their essence extinguished by Heaven and are denied the offerings of their sacrifices. Thus do they assist Heaven and Earth and complete the storage of human beings. Therefore, with the *qi* of the cool winds, they refine and purify human forms; if a human form is not upright, they rectify it with talismans. Talismans commonly arise from *ren* and *gui*, governing *hai* and *zi*. Those who ought to receive talismans and pay homage all turn toward the sundial.

The *Chart of the Divine Immortals* states:
The Perfected of the Five Marchmounts guard the palaces and halls of the Son of Heaven. The method employs five *jin* of realgar, one *jin* for each marchmount. Seal with wax to fashion figures twelve *cun* in length, place them in a large jar of five *dou* capacity, and suspend them by their directional colors from the great beams of the palace halls. This benefits the palace chambers, dispels inauspiciousness, and subdues the four directions. The kingdom flourishes, and myriad blessings arrive for ten thousand years.

**White Tiger Talisman**
Laozi said: Yao transmitted the rites of sacrifice to Shun, and in the first month on the day *jiawu*, Shun performed the sacrifice of the *Chart of the Mysterious Talismans* beneath Mount Li. By the fourth month, a divine messenger riding a white deer announced the Queen Mother of the West and presented Shun with a white jade ring. In the second month of his first year, Shun transmitted it to Yu. In the sixth month of that year, auspicious clouds appeared three times. The ritual of sacrifice employs drums and grand drums to summon the Straight Talismans. One Straight Talisman corresponds to one drumbeat; two Straight Talismans, to two drumbeats. When one thousand two hundred Straight Talismans have arrived, then the Transfiguring Jade Maidens are invited, followed by the Jade Maidens of the Mountain Spirits of the Five Phases, and finally the Divine Ears of the Supreme August. For three days, the precepts are upheld and the altar established, with three incense fires and fruits offered in accordance with the four seasons. The central altar is arranged with the five colors of the upper and lower as a mat. Do not recklessly transmit or divulge this. **Five Marchmount Talismans**

The Upper Talisman suppresses and pacifies the malign qi and wood essence of the East. When toxins and harm spread, bandits and raiders arise frequently, the five grains do not flourish, the people suffer many demonic disasters, violent floods emerge, and locusts swarm—this is the doing of the Spirit Gou Mang. The method of suppression and pacification: use the three sacrificial animals at the far eastern border, first offering to Heaven and Earth. The altar face measures twelve zhang, with silk cloth laid as a mat for sixty cups. Use one *hu* and two *dou* of rice, and five-colored pigments mixed with white earth to create the Human-Dragon Talisman. On the west side, inscribe cinnabar characters on white silk twelve *chi* in length. Prepare twelve white jars, placing six *liang* of realgar and twelve *jin* of cinnabar inside. Place the talisman atop the jars, seal the mouths tightly with wax, and stamp with the seal of Shu Shou. Cast them into the deep abyss at the eastern border of the state, ensuring no omens are seen.

The Upper Talisman suppresses and pacifies the malign qi and fire essence of the South. When toxins and harm spread, bandits and raiders arise frequently, the five grains do not flourish, the people often flee, and rivers, seas, and lakes overflow—this is the doing of the Spirit Zhu Rong. The method of suppression and pacification: use the three sacrificial animals at the far southern waters, first offering to Heaven and Earth. The altar face measures twelve zhang, with silk cloth laid as a mat for sixty cups. Use one *hu* and two *dou* of white rice, and five-colored pigments mixed with black earth to create the Human-Dragon Talisman. On the north side, inscribe cinnabar characters on silk twelve *chi* in length. Prepare twelve black jars, placing six *liang* of realgar and twelve *jin* of cinnabar inside. Place the talisman atop the jars, seal the mouths tightly with wax, and stamp with the seal of Xuan Ming. Cast them into the deep abyss at the southern border, ensuring no omens are seen.

The Upper Talisman suppresses and pacifies the four qi and earth essence of the Center. When toxins and harm spread, mountains collapse and the earth quakes, and the four barbarians are unsettled—this is the doing of the Spirit Hou Tu. The method of suppression and pacification: use the three sacrificial animals at the state’s center, erecting an altar on level ground with a face of twenty-eight zhang and one hundred twenty cups, with silk cloth laid as a mat. Use one *hu* and two *dou* of rice, and five-colored pigments mixed with green earth to create the Human-Dragon Talisman. On the east side, inscribe cinnabar characters on green silk twelve *chi* in length. Prepare twelve white jars, placing six *liang* of realgar and twelve *jin* of cinnabar inside. Seal the mouths tightly with wax, stamp with the seal of Gou Mang, and cast them into the state’s center.

The Upper Talisman suppresses and pacifies the malign qi and metal essence of the West. When toxins and harm spread, bandits and raiders arise frequently, the five grains do not flourish, soldiers are disturbed, violent floods surge, and locusts harm the grain—this is the doing of the Spirit Shu Shou. The method of suppression and pacification: use the three sacrificial animals at the far western border, first offering to Heaven and Earth. The altar face measures twelve zhang, with crimson cloth laid as a mat for sixty cups. Use one *hu* and two *dou* of rice, and five-colored pigments mixed with red earth to create the Human-Dragon Talisman. On the south side, inscribe cinnabar characters on crimson silk twelve *chi* in length. Prepare twelve red jars, placing six *liang* of realgar and twelve *jin* of cinnabar inside. Place the talisman atop the jars, seal the mouths tightly with wax, and stamp with the seal of Zhu Rong. Cast them into the deep abyss at the western border, ensuring no omens are seen.

The Upper Talisman suppresses and pacifies the malign qi and water essence of the North. When toxins and harm spread, yin forces prevail with torrential rains, waters surge and mountains collapse, and raiders violently arise—this is the doing of the Spirit Xuan Ming. The method of suppression and pacification: use the three sacrificial animals at the far northern border, first offering to Heaven and Earth. The altar face measures twelve zhang, with yellow cloth laid as a mat for sixty cups. Use one *hu* and two *dou* of rice, and five-colored pigments mixed with yellow earth to create the Human-Dragon Talisman. In the center, inscribe cinnabar characters on yellow silk twelve *chi* in length. Prepare twelve yellow jars, placing six *liang* of realgar and twelve *jin* of cinnabar inside. Place the talisman atop the jars, seal the mouths tightly with wax, and stamp with the seal of Hou Tu. Cast them into the deep abyss at the northern border, ensuring no omens are seen.

**The Talisman of Great Peace**
In the first month of the *jiazi* year, the first year of the Phoenix reign of Emperor Yao, the master-shaman Xian received this from the Son of Heaven Yao, who ruled all under Heaven, the Five Marchmounts, the Four Waterways, mountains, and rivers. The spirits who oversee constant prohibitions, when Heaven employs suppression and pacification, thereby awe the Four Seas, subdue the Eight Barbarians, prevent the rise of armed bandits, and naturally dispel plagues and epidemics. They respond like an echo, and the spirits ever assist. The ritual of sacrifice employs the three sacrificial animals, ox horns five *cun* in length, sheep horns seven *cun* in length, one hundred twenty *jin* of fat, five *hu* of clear wine, yellow non-glutinous rice, and twelve kinds of fruits. Incense fires are placed on each side, three in number. The altar face measures twenty-eight zhang, with white cogon grass as a mat, two *chi* and two *cun* in length. Also use five *dou* of non-glutinous rice, one thousand two hundred cups, and four hundred cups on the face. A pole twenty-eight *chi* in length is erected in the central courtyard, with a twelve-zhang banner, equal on all four sides. Five large tables are set, with twenty-four cups, totaling one hundred twenty cups. The five colors are arranged in order, and silk four *zhang* and one *chi* in length is inscribed. The pure noble’s son and inner ministers observe the three-day precepts before the sacrifice. In the third month of the first year, the sacrifice is performed to receive the qi of fortune, and in the third month, the qi of harmony appears. In three years, all under Heaven attains Great Peace.

**The Talisman of Majestic Virtue**
The Talisman of the August Supreme’s Majestic Virtue. This talisman is for nobles from the Three Dukes downward to local magistrates, all officials with seals and cords. On the first *wang* day of the first month, they receive this talisman and place it in their seal pouch. When serving the emperor, the lord and his ministers enjoy good fortune, spirits are subdued, the people are at peace, bandits cease, officials are promoted and prosper, and all affairs are auspicious.

**The Five Generals’ Talisman**
Fan Li’s Five Generals’ Talisman governs military affairs, using the talisman to break enemies and suppress multitudes. Ten thousand men dare not face those who bear this talisman. Later, Fan Li defeated Wu. On the day of *jigeng*, he performed the libation ritual for this talisman atop Nanshan, and King Goujian of Yue thereby became hegemon of Langya. Goujian was narrow-minded and suspicious, harboring jealousy in his heart, unable to complete the imperial enterprise. Thus, his joys and sorrows shifted, his cruelty and indulgence alternated, like carving rotten wood. Lord Fan, discerning the signs, fled to the borders of Qi, where he secretly cultivated rituals and libations, praying in secret to Heaven and humanity. Later, he became Prime Minister of Qi, known as Master Chi Yi Zi Pi.

Sighing that in private life he amassed a thousand gold pieces, and in officialdom attained the rank of minister or chancellor—this was the pinnacle for a commoner—he deemed long-received honorifics inauspicious and thus returned the ministerial seal.

Later, he settled in Tao, surpassing the wealth of all past ages, his benevolence extending to later generations, and was styled Lord Tao Zhu. His original name was Shaobo, a native of Xu, who studied under the Grand Duke Lü Shang. He often employed wondrous methods to encourage and guide the virtuous, bestowing teachings upon the Lords of Zhou and Su, as well as the Four Whiteheads of Qin. For the Han founder’s secret affairs, all were entrusted to Zhang Liang, who personally befriended the Four Whiteheads and constantly cultivated merit alongside them.

Among Lord Zhu’s disciples was Zhu Zhong, who traded pearls in Kuaiji and presented his arts to Empress Lü. The Empress, unable to employ them, stored both the man and his diagrams away.

Here ends the *Supreme Cavernous Numinous Treasure Talismans of the Five Marchmounts*.

chunks.original_text: 太上洞玄灵宝五岳神符 经名：太上洞玄灵宝五岳神符。 又名《五岳神仙图》。 撰人不详，约出於南北朝。 唐法琳《辨正论》已引。 一卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》洞玄部神符类。 太上洞玄灵宝五岳神符 神仙图曰：东方泰岳祇曰岱宗，元气上连岁星，其山青，灵老君治其中，主春气，生万物。 列从青腰玉女百二十人，主百二十府。 变化玉女九人，主九州。 山精玉女万二千人，主游护天下，使甲乙之神行天德，使寅卯之神正地气。 名山大泽天下万神，常以立春之日升岱宗之山，入青石玉阙之宫，谒青灵老君，受玄符。 出乘条风，各还四方，召使百鬼，斩杀恶神。 有不从玄符者，天灭其精，不得享其祭祠，所以佐天地生人物也。 以条风之气荡淑人形，人形不正，正之以符。 常起甲乙，治寅卯，受符应当拜者，皆回向日晷。 神仙图曰：南方泰岳祇曰南衡，元气上连荧惑之星，其山赤，太阳炎老君治其中，主夏气，长万物。 列从泰丹玉女百二十人，主百二十府。 变化玉女九人，主九州。 山精玉女万二千人，主游护天下，使丙丁之神行天德，使巳午之神正地气。 名山大泽天下万神，常以立夏之日，升南衡之山，入赤石玉阙之宫，谒炎老君受玄符。 出乘长风，各还四方，召使百鬼，斩杀恶神。 有不从玄符者，天灭其精，不得享其祭祠。 所以佐天地、生人物也。 故以长风之气荡淑人形，人形不正，正之以符。 常起丙丁，治巳午，受符应当拜者，皆回向日晷。 神仙图曰：中央泰岳祇曰嵩高，元气上连镇星，其山黄，黄老君治其中，主四季之气，统四岳之神，总理万物。 列从黄素玉女，四方变化玉女各五万人，主巡行。 山精玉女五万人，主游护天下。 使戊己之神行天德，使丑辰、未戌之神正地气。 名山大泽天下万神，常以四季正月晦，升嵩高，入黄石玉阙之宫，谒黄老君，受玄符。 出乘八风，各还四方。 玄符常在己，不言而道自存，不行而道自明，淡泊无为，为道之根，出则病病，故而不病。 吾之不病，死无从来。 是以玄符长守子命，华盖盖之，延年以镇星。 星杆子厄，大阖天门，广地户，窈窈冥冥，万神自然。 五岳之玄符，五德之为信，赏善罚恶，养人物也。 故以八风和符，调人正之，受符应当拜者，皆回向日晷。 神仙图曰：西方泰岳祇曰西华，元气上连太白星，其山白，皇老君治其中，主秋气，成熟万物。 列从白素玉女百二十人，主百二十府。 变化玉女九人，主九州。 山精玉女万二千人，主游护天下，使庚辛之神行天德，使申酉之神正地气。 名山大泽天下万神，常以立秋之臼，升西华之山，入白石玉阙之宫，谒皇老君，受玄符。 出乘清风，各还四方，召使百鬼，斩杀恶神。 有不从玄符者，天灭其精，不得享其祭祠。 所以佐天地、成人物也。 故以清风之气荡淑人形，人形不正，正之以符。 常以庚辛治申酉，受符应当拜者，皆回向日晷。 神仙图曰：北方泰岳祇曰北恒，元气上连辰星，其山黑，太阴玄老君治其中，主冬气，闭藏万物。 列从太玄玉女百二十人，主百二十府。 变化玉女九人，主九州。

On the last day of the first month of each season, the myriad spirits of the world’s famous mountains and great marshes ascend Mount Song, entering the Palace of Yellow Stone and Jade Towers to pay homage to the Yellow Venerable Lord and receive the Mysterious Talismans. They emerge riding the Eight Winds, returning to the four directions. The Mysterious Talisman ever abides in *ji*; without speech, the Dao is naturally present; without action, the Dao is naturally luminous. In quiescence and non-action lies the root of the Dao. If it issues forth, illness arises, yet it remains unill. My non-illness means death has no way to approach. Thus does the Mysterious Talisman eternally guard your life, covered by the Canopy of Florescence, prolonging your years with Saturn’s stability. When Saturn’s staff is endangered, the great gates of Heaven close, the portals of Earth widen, and in profound obscurity, the myriad spirits arise spontaneously. The Mysterious Talismans of the Five Marchmounts are the tokens of the Five Powers’ fidelity, rewarding good and punishing evil, nurturing the beings of the world. Thus, with the Eight Winds harmonizing the talismans, they regulate and rectify humanity. Those who ought to receive talismans and pay homage all turn toward the sundial.

The *Chart of the Divine Immortals* states:
The numen of the Western Marchmount is called Mount Hua of the West, its primordial *qi* ascending to connect with Venus. Its mountain is white. The August Venerable Lord governs within, presiding over the *qi* of autumn and the ripening of the myriad beings. Arrayed in attendance are one hundred twenty Jade Maidens of White Simplicity, who oversee the one hundred twenty palaces. Nine Transfiguring Jade Maidens govern the Nine Provinces. Twelve thousand Jade Maidens of Mountain Spirits patrol and protect the world, dispatching the spirits of *geng* and *xin* to enact celestial virtue, and the spirits of *shen* and *you* to rectify terrestrial *qi*. On the day of the Beginning of Autumn, the myriad spirits of the world’s famous mountains and great marshes ascend Mount Hua of the West, entering the Palace of White Stone and Jade Towers to pay homage to the August Elder and receive the Mysterious Talismans. They emerge riding the *qingfeng* winds, returning to the four directions to summon and command the hundred demons, slaying malevolent spirits. Those who disobey the Mysterious Talismans shall have their essence extinguished by Heaven and be denied the offerings of their sacrifices. Thus do they assist Heaven and Earth in ripening the beings of the world. With the *qi* of the *qingfeng* winds, they refine and purify human forms; if a human form is not upright, they rectify it with talismans. Those who regularly govern *shen* and *you* with *geng* and *xin*, and who ought to receive talismans and pay homage, all turn toward the sundial.

The *Chart of the Divine Immortals* states:
The numen of the Northern Marchmount is called Mount Heng of the North, its primordial *qi* ascending to connect with Mercury. Its mountain is black. The Venerable Lord of Mysterious Lunar Elders governs within, presiding over the *qi* of winter and the storage of the myriad beings. Arrayed in attendance are one hundred twenty Jade Maidens of Grand Mystery, who oversee the one hundred twenty palaces. Nine Transfiguring Jade Maidens govern the Nine Provinces.

chunks.original_text: 山精玉女万二千人，主游护天下。 使壬癸之神行天德，亥子之神正地气。 名山大泽天下万神，常以立冬之日，升北恒之山，入黑石玉阙之宫，谒玄老君，受玄符。 出乘凉风，各还四方，召使百鬼，斩杀恶神。 有不从玄符者，天灭其精，不得享其祭柯。 所以佐天地、藏人物也。 故以凉风荡淑人形，人形不正、正之以符，符常起壬癸，治亥子。 受符应当拜者，皆回向日晷。 神仙图曰：五岳真人镇天子宫殿堂，法用雄黄五斤，每岳用一斤，以蜡密作人，长尺二寸，置五斗大瓶中，随方色悬置殿中大梁，利宫室，除凶恶，厌服四方。 国中兴盛，来福万年。 白虎符 老子曰：尧以祭法授舜，舜以正月甲午，於历山下祭图玄符。 到四月，神使骑白鹿，言西王母，以白环献舜。 元年二月，舜以授禹。 其年六月，景云三见。 祭法鼓吹大鼓，召直符。 一直符，二鼓音，二直符，二鼓音，千二百直符到，然后请变化玉女，次请五行山精玉女，然后请上皇神耳。 三日奉戒立坛，即香火三，果实追四时，中坛按上下五色为藉。 勿妄传泄。 五镇符
chunks.translated_text:
The Mountain Spirits and Jade Maidens, numbering twelve thousand, govern the roaming protection of the world. They dispatch the *shen* of *ren* and *gui* to enact the celestial virtue, and the *shen* of *hai* and *zi* to rectify the terrestrial *qi*. On the sacred mountains and great marshes, the myriad *shen* of the world, on the day of the Beginning of Winter, ascend Mount Heng of the North and enter the palace of Black Stone Jade Gates to pay homage to the Venerable Lord of Mysterious Lunar Elders and receive the Mysterious Talismans. Emerging, they ride the cool winds and return to the four directions, summoning the hundred ghosts and slaying malevolent *shen*. Those who do not obey the Mysterious Talismans have their essence extinguished by Heaven and are denied the offerings of their sacrifices. Thus do they assist Heaven and Earth and complete the storage of human beings. Therefore, with the *qi* of the cool winds, they refine and purify human forms; if a human form is not upright, they rectify it with talismans. Talismans commonly arise from *ren* and *gui*, governing *hai* and *zi*. Those who ought to receive talismans and pay homage all turn toward the sundial.

The *Chart of the Divine Immortals* states:
The Perfected of the Five Marchmounts guard the palaces and halls of the Son of Heaven. The method employs five *jin* of realgar, one *jin* for each marchmount. Seal with wax to fashion figures twelve *cun* in length, place them in a large jar of five *dou* capacity, and suspend them by their directional colors from the great beams of the palace halls. This benefits the palace chambers, dispels inauspiciousness, and subdues the four directions. The kingdom flourishes, and myriad blessings arrive for ten thousand years.

**White Tiger Talisman**
Laozi said: Yao transmitted the rites of sacrifice to Shun, and in the first month on the day *jiawu*, Shun performed the sacrifice of the *Chart of the Mysterious Talismans* beneath Mount Li. By the fourth month, a divine messenger riding a white deer announced the Queen Mother of the West and presented Shun with a white jade ring. In the second month of his first year, Shun transmitted it to Yu. In the sixth month of that year, auspicious clouds appeared three times. The ritual of sacrifice employs drums and grand drums to summon the Straight Talismans. One Straight Talisman corresponds to one drumbeat; two Straight Talismans, to two drumbeats. When one thousand two hundred Straight Talismans have arrived, then the Transfiguring Jade Maidens are invited, followed by the Jade Maidens of the Mountain Spirits of the Five Phases, and finally the Divine Ears of the Supreme August. For three days, the precepts are upheld and the altar established, with three incense fires and fruits offered in accordance with the four seasons. The central altar is arranged with the five colors of the upper and lower as a mat. Do not recklessly transmit or divulge this. **Five Marchmount Talismans**

chunks.original_text: 上符厌镇东方恶气木精。 毒害流行，寇贼数起，五谷不丰，民多妖灾，暴水出，蝗虫起，此勾芒神所为。 厌镇之法，用三牲物极东界上，先祭天地。 坛面十二丈，以帛布为藉面六十杯，用米一斛二斗，五彩校以白土，作人龙符，西方丹书素丈二尺，白瓮十二枚，以雄黄六两，丹砂十二斤，以着瓮中。 符在上，蜡密塞口，蓐收印封，投国东界上深渊之中，勿令兆见。 上符厌镇南方恶气火精。 毒害流行，寇贼数起，五谷不丰，民多流移，淀河海江，此是祝融之神所为。 厌镇之法，用三牲物於极南水上，先祭天地。 其坛面十二丈，以帛布为藉面六十杯，一斛二斗白米，五色校以黑土、作人龙符，北方丹书帛丈二尺，黑瓮十二枚，雄黄六两，丹砂十二斤，以着瓮中。 符在上，蜡密塞口，玄冥印封，投南界深渊之中，勿令兆见。 上符厌镇中央四气土精。 毒害流行，山崩地动，四夷不安，此是后土神所为。 厌镇之法，用三牲物於国中央，平地立坛面二十八丈，面百二十杯，以帛布为藉。 用一斛二斗米，五彩校青土，作人龙符，东方丹书青丈二尺，白瓮十二枚，雄黄六两，丹砂十二斤，以着瓮中，蜡密塞口，勾芒印封，投国中央。 上符厌镇西方恶气金精。 毒害流行，寇贼数起，五谷不丰，军士扰动，暴水横出，蝗虫害谷，此蓐收神所为。 厌镇之法，用三牲物於极西界上，先祭天地。 坛面十二丈，绛布为藉面六十杯，米一斛二斗，五色校以赤土，作人龙符，南方丹书绛丈二尺，赤瓮十二枚，雄黄六两，丹砂十二斤，以着瓮中。 符在上，蜡密塞口，祝融印封，投西界上深渊之中，勿令兆见。 上符厌镇北方恶气水精。 毒害流行，运阴大雨洪注，水出山崩，贼虏暴起，是玄冥之神所为。 厌镇之法，用三牲物於极北界上，先祭天地。 坛面十二丈，以黄布为藉面六十杯，米一斛二斗，五色校以黄土，作人龙符。 中央丹书黄丈二尺，黄瓮十二枚，雄黄六两，丹砂十二斤，以着瓮中。 符在上，蜡密塞口，后土印封，投北界上深渊之中，勿令兆见。 太平符 尧凤凰元年正月甲子，师巫咸，受尧天子，王有天下，五岳四渎山川，常禁司神，天有厌镇，以威四海，服八夷，兵寇不起，疾疫自除，与响相应，神常助之。 祭法用三牲物，牛角五寸，羊角七寸，脂百二十斤，清酒五斛，黄粢米饭，果实十二，香火每面三枚，坛面二十八丈，白茅为席，长二尺二寸，亦用粢米五斗，千二百杯，面四百杯，二丈八尺长竿立之中庭，十二丈旛，四方等，五大案，二十四杯，合百二十杯，五色相校，书缯四丈一尺。 清人公子内臣，临祭三日受戒。 元年三月，祭受福气见，三月令平气见，三年天下太平。 威德符 上皇威德符。 符主贵人三公以下，至令长，诸印绶长吏，常以正月上王之日，受此符以投绶囊，臣事帝王，人君吉庆，伏鬼神，安人民，息盗贼，官保迁利，百事吉祥。 五将军符 范蠡五将军，主军事，以符破敌厌众，万人不敢当向此符者。 范蠡后来败吴，以季庚之日，醮此符於南山之上，越王遂霸琅琊。 勾践智褊，猜忌在心，不能克成帝业，遂乃忧乐易情，残忍易恣，朽木难雕。 范公知机，肥遁齐境，潜修杞醮，密祷天人，后为齐相，号鸱夷子皮。
chunks.translated_text:
The Upper Talisman suppresses and pacifies the malign qi and wood essence of the East. When toxins and harm spread, bandits and raiders arise frequently, the five grains do not flourish, the people suffer many demonic disasters, violent floods emerge, and locusts swarm—this is the doing of the Spirit Gou Mang. The method of suppression and pacification: use the three sacrificial animals at the far eastern border, first offering to Heaven and Earth. The altar face measures twelve zhang, with silk cloth laid as a mat for sixty cups. Use one *hu* and two *dou* of rice, and five-colored pigments mixed with white earth to create the Human-Dragon Talisman. On the west side, inscribe cinnabar characters on white silk twelve *chi* in length. Prepare twelve white jars, placing six *liang* of realgar and twelve *jin* of cinnabar inside. Place the talisman atop the jars, seal the mouths tightly with wax, and stamp with the seal of Shu Shou. Cast them into the deep abyss at the eastern border of the state, ensuring no omens are seen.

The Upper Talisman suppresses and pacifies the malign qi and fire essence of the South. When toxins and harm spread, bandits and raiders arise frequently, the five grains do not flourish, the people often flee, and rivers, seas, and lakes overflow—this is the doing of the Spirit Zhu Rong. The method of suppression and pacification: use the three sacrificial animals at the far southern waters, first offering to Heaven and Earth. The altar face measures twelve zhang, with silk cloth laid as a mat for sixty cups. Use one *hu* and two *dou* of white rice, and five-colored pigments mixed with black earth to create the Human-Dragon Talisman. On the north side, inscribe cinnabar characters on silk twelve *chi* in length. Prepare twelve black jars, placing six *liang* of realgar and twelve *jin* of cinnabar inside. Place the talisman atop the jars, seal the mouths tightly with wax, and stamp with the seal of Xuan Ming. Cast them into the deep abyss at the southern border, ensuring no omens are seen.

The Upper Talisman suppresses and pacifies the four qi and earth essence of the Center. When toxins and harm spread, mountains collapse and the earth quakes, and the four barbarians are unsettled—this is the doing of the Spirit Hou Tu. The method of suppression and pacification: use the three sacrificial animals at the state’s center, erecting an altar on level ground with a face of twenty-eight zhang and one hundred twenty cups, with silk cloth laid as a mat. Use one *hu* and two *dou* of rice, and five-colored pigments mixed with green earth to create the Human-Dragon Talisman. On the east side, inscribe cinnabar characters on green silk twelve *chi* in length. Prepare twelve white jars, placing six *liang* of realgar and twelve *jin* of cinnabar inside. Seal the mouths tightly with wax, stamp with the seal of Gou Mang, and cast them into the state’s center.

The Upper Talisman suppresses and pacifies the malign qi and metal essence of the West. When toxins and harm spread, bandits and raiders arise frequently, the five grains do not flourish, soldiers are disturbed, violent floods surge, and locusts harm the grain—this is the doing of the Spirit Shu Shou. The method of suppression and pacification: use the three sacrificial animals at the far western border, first offering to Heaven and Earth. The altar face measures twelve zhang, with crimson cloth laid as a mat for sixty cups. Use one *hu* and two *dou* of rice, and five-colored pigments mixed with red earth to create the Human-Dragon Talisman. On the south side, inscribe cinnabar characters on crimson silk twelve *chi* in length. Prepare twelve red jars, placing six *liang* of realgar and twelve *jin* of cinnabar inside. Place the talisman atop the jars, seal the mouths tightly with wax, and stamp with the seal of Zhu Rong. Cast them into the deep abyss at the western border, ensuring no omens are seen.

The Upper Talisman suppresses and pacifies the malign qi and water essence of the North. When toxins and harm spread, yin forces prevail with torrential rains, waters surge and mountains collapse, and raiders violently arise—this is the doing of the Spirit Xuan Ming. The method of suppression and pacification: use the three sacrificial animals at the far northern border, first offering to Heaven and Earth. The altar face measures twelve zhang, with yellow cloth laid as a mat for sixty cups. Use one *hu* and two *dou* of rice, and five-colored pigments mixed with yellow earth to create the Human-Dragon Talisman. In the center, inscribe cinnabar characters on yellow silk twelve *chi* in length. Prepare twelve yellow jars, placing six *liang* of realgar and twelve *jin* of cinnabar inside. Place the talisman atop the jars, seal the mouths tightly with wax, and stamp with the seal of Hou Tu. Cast them into the deep abyss at the northern border, ensuring no omens are seen.

**The Talisman of Great Peace**
In the first month of the *jiazi* year, the first year of the Phoenix reign of Emperor Yao, the master-shaman Xian received this from the Son of Heaven Yao, who ruled all under Heaven, the Five Marchmounts, the Four Waterways, mountains, and rivers. The spirits who oversee constant prohibitions, when Heaven employs suppression and pacification, thereby awe the Four Seas, subdue the Eight Barbarians, prevent the rise of armed bandits, and naturally dispel plagues and epidemics. They respond like an echo, and the spirits ever assist. The ritual of sacrifice employs the three sacrificial animals, ox horns five *cun* in length, sheep horns seven *cun* in length, one hundred twenty *jin* of fat, five *hu* of clear wine, yellow non-glutinous rice, and twelve kinds of fruits. Incense fires are placed on each side, three in number. The altar face measures twenty-eight zhang, with white cogon grass as a mat, two *chi* and two *cun* in length. Also use five *dou* of non-glutinous rice, one thousand two hundred cups, and four hundred cups on the face. A pole twenty-eight *chi* in length is erected in the central courtyard, with a twelve-zhang banner, equal on all four sides. Five large tables are set, with twenty-four cups, totaling one hundred twenty cups. The five colors are arranged in order, and silk four *zhang* and one *chi* in length is inscribed. The pure noble’s son and inner ministers observe the three-day precepts before the sacrifice. In the third month of the first year, the sacrifice is performed to receive the qi of fortune, and in the third month, the qi of harmony appears. In three years, all under Heaven attains Great Peace.

**The Talisman of Majestic Virtue**
The Talisman of the August Supreme’s Majestic Virtue. This talisman is for nobles from the Three Dukes downward to local magistrates, all officials with seals and cords. On the first *wang* day of the first month, they receive this talisman and place it in their seal pouch. When serving the emperor, the lord and his ministers enjoy good fortune, spirits are subdued, the people are at peace, bandits cease, officials are promoted and prosper, and all affairs are auspicious.

**The Five Generals’ Talisman**
Fan Li’s Five Generals’ Talisman governs military affairs, using the talisman to break enemies and suppress multitudes. Ten thousand men dare not face those who bear this talisman. Later, Fan Li defeated Wu. On the day of *jigeng*, he performed the libation ritual for this talisman atop Nanshan, and King Goujian of Yue thereby became hegemon of Langya. Goujian was narrow-minded and suspicious, harboring jealousy in his heart, unable to complete the imperial enterprise. Thus, his joys and sorrows shifted, his cruelty and indulgence alternated, like carving rotten wood. Lord Fan, discerning the signs, fled to the borders of Qi, where he secretly cultivated rituals and libations, praying in secret to Heaven and humanity. Later, he became Prime Minister of Qi, known as Master Chi Yi Zi Pi.

chunks.original_text: 自叹居家则致千金，仕宦则致卿相，此布衣之极，久受尊名不祥，乃归相印。 又居陶，富高前世，恩被后生，号陶朱公。 本字少伯，徐人，师太公吕尚，常以妙法奖导善人，授周、苏二君，及秦之四皓。 汉祖密事，悉委张良，良亲四皓，恒共修功。 朱公弟子又有珠仲，贩珠会稽，献术高后，后不能用，与图俱藏也。 太上洞玄灵宝五岳神符竟

Sighing that in private life he amassed a thousand gold pieces, and in officialdom attained the rank of minister or chancellor—this was the pinnacle for a commoner—he deemed long-received honorifics inauspicious and thus returned the ministerial seal.

Later, he settled in Tao, surpassing the wealth of all past ages, his benevolence extending to later generations, and was styled Lord Tao Zhu. His original name was Shaobo, a native of Xu, who studied under the Grand Duke Lü Shang. He often employed wondrous methods to encourage and guide the virtuous, bestowing teachings upon the Lords of Zhou and Su, as well as the Four Whiteheads of Qin. For the Han founder’s secret affairs, all were entrusted to Zhang Liang, who personally befriended the Four Whiteheads and constantly cultivated merit alongside them.

Among Lord Zhu’s disciples was Zhu Zhong, who traded pearls in Kuaiji and presented his arts to Empress Lü. The Empress, unable to employ them, stored both the man and his diagrams away.
